New Records: Corbin Carroll became the first player in MLB history to have three or more hits and two or more stolen bases in a Game 7.
Key Match Events: Diamondbacks won the NLCS in a seventh game to advance to the World Series
Diamondbacks scored after trailing 2-1 in the fifth inning to take the lead and never trail again
Brandon Pfaadt pitched effectively, allowing just two runs over four innings
Diamondbacks' bullpen shut down the Phillies in the late innings
Corbin Carroll had a memorable performance with three hits, two stolen bases, and two runs scored
Pre-Game Insights: Diamondbacks were underestimated throughout the playoffs
Manager Torey Lovullo dismissed doubts and emphasized the team's resilience
Chris Russo made bold predictions that were proven wrong by the Diamondbacks' victory
Post-Match Reflections: Diamondbacks players and manager expressed pride and disbelief at their World Series berth
Evan Longoria highlighted the team's journey and resilience
Mike Hazen's decision not to tear down the roster in 2022 was praised for the team's subsequent success
Miscellaneous Highlights: Diamondbacks are the fifth team in MLB history to go from over 100 losses to the World Series in two years
